case_vignette: A previously healthy 16-year-old boy is brought to the physician by his parents for evaluation because of extreme irritability, fatigue, and loss of appetite for 3 weeks. Five months ago, his grandfather, whom he was very close to, passed away from chronic lymphocytic leukemia. He used to enjoy playing soccer but quit his soccer team last week. When he comes home from school he goes straight to bed and sleeps for 11–12 hours each night. He previously had good grades, but his teachers report that he has been disrespectful and distracted in class and failed an exam last week. He tried alcohol twice at a party last year and he has never smoked cigarettes. Vital signs are within normal limits. On mental status examination, he avoids making eye contact but cooperates with the exam. His affect is limited and he describes an irritable mood. He is easily distracted and has a difficult time focusing for an extended conversation.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been feeling extremely irritable, tired, and I've lost my appetite for the past 3 weeks.
Have you noticed any changes in your weight recently?
No, nobody has mentioned anything about my weight changing.
Are you currently experiencing any physical pain or discomfort?
No, I don't have any physical pain or discomfort.
Do you have any history of depression or anxiety?
I haven't had depression or anxiety before.
Are you currently taking any medications or substances, including over-the-counter, prescription, or recreational drugs?
I tried alcohol twice at a party last year, but I don't use any medications or drugs.
How has your sleep been affected in these last few weeks?
I've been sleeping for 11–12 hours each night as soon as I get home from school.
Have there been any recent major changes or stressors in your life, like at school or home?
Yes, my grandfather, whom I was very close to, passed away from an illness five months ago.
How old are you?
I'm 16 years old.
Are you experiencing any difficulty with concentration or decision-making lately?
Yes, I'm easily distracted and having a hard time focusing during conversations.
Do you feel sad or hopeless, or have you lost interest in activities you usually enjoy?
I quit my soccer team last week, which I used to enjoy, and I've been feeling really irritable.
Final Diagnosis: Major Depressive Disorder
